documents.name: Legal Terms
documents.text:
Welcome to Prolific! We hope you’ll enjoy working with our platform.

<aside>. 🤝 Before you register to use our platform, whether as a researcher or as a user, please make sure you have read and understood the legal terms applicable to you, which describe your (and our) legal rights and obligations in relation to your use of Prolific.

</aside>

As a quick bit of context: we, means Prolific Academic Ltd, and Prolific is the platform we provide for launching and recruiting for research studies which we make available through our Website at www.prolific.co.

Researcher Terms

Here are the terms for Researchers who use Prolific to conduct studies

NOTE: Prolific has updated its T&Cs for Researchers and Participants. . The main change is around the ability to request audio, image and video data in studies. . The Participants' Privacy Notice has also been updated to reflect this addition. . So, if you are an existing researcher as at 6th July 2023 then the current Researcher T&Cs will continue to apply to all your studies launched before 6th August 2023. For studies launched (i) from 6th August 2023 by existing Researchers and (ii) for studies launched from 7th July by newly registered Researchers, the new T&Cs will apply. . The amended Participant Privacy Notice will also apply immediately.

Participant Terms

Here are the terms for Participants who use Prolific to take part in studies

NOTE: Prolific has updated its T&Cs for Researchers and Participants. . The main change is around the ability to request audio, image and video data in studies. . The Participants' Privacy Notice has also been updated to reflect this addition. . So, if you are an existing researcher as at 6th July 2023 then the current Researcher T&Cs will continue to apply to all your studies launched before 6th August 2023. For studies launched (i) from 6th August 2023 by existing Researchers and (ii) for studies launched from 7th July by newly registered Researchers, the new T&Cs will apply. . The amended Participant Privacy Notice will also apply immediately.

Users of our Website

Here are the terms which apply to users of our Website (whether registered users or just browsing).

Here's a diagram to give you an understanding of our legal relationships.

In addition to the applicable legal terms, you may wish to read our privacy notices, which provide you with more information about how we may receive and use your personal data.

documents.name: Cookies
documents.text:
When you use the Site it will store data on your device by two methods: web storage and cookies. Web storage means the storage of data within your browser. A cookie is a small file, which is stored on the device which you use to access the Site. You can read more about web storage at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_storage and about cookies at http://aboutcookies.org.

The web storage and cookies we use allow us to monitor the use of the Site and to improve our service offering. The following section describes what kinds of cookies we use.

Cookies that we use

We use cookies for the following purposes:

(a) authentication – we use cookies to identify you when you visit our website and as you navigate our website. (b) status – we use cookies to help us to determine if you are logged into our website. and (c) cookie consent – we use cookies to store your preferences in relation to the use of cookies more generally.

Cookies used by our service providers

Our service providers use cookies and those cookies may be stored on your computer, when you visit our website for the purposes, stated below.

Cookies

Managing cookies

Most browsers allow you to refuse to accept cookies and to delete cookies. The methods for doing so vary from browser to browser, and from version to version. You can however obtain up-to-date information about blocking and deleting cookies via these links:

(a) https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?hl=en (Chrome). (b) https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enable-and-disable-cookies-website-p references (Firefox). (c) http://www.opera.com/help/tutorials/security/cookies/ (Opera). (d) https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/17442/windows-internet-explorerdelete-manage-cookies (Internet Explorer). (e) https://support.apple.com/kb/PH21411 (Safari). and (f) https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10-microsoft-edge-and-privac y (Edge).

Blocking all cookies will have a negative impact upon the usability of many websites.

If you block cookies, you will not be able to use all the features on our website.
